trans-unit.source: Azure Notification Hubs Notify Users
trans-unit.target: Azure Notification Hubs Notify Users

trans-unit.source: Learn how to send secure push notifications in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to send secure push notifications in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Code samples written in C# using the .NET API.
trans-unit.target: Code samples written in C# using the .NET API.

trans-unit.source: Azure Notification Hubs Notify Users
trans-unit.target: Azure Notification Hubs Notify Users

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Push notification support in Azure enables you to access an easy-to-use, multiplatform, and scaled-out push infrastructure, which greatly simplifies the implementation of push notifications for both consumer and enterprise applications for mobile platforms.
trans-unit.target: Push notification support in Azure enables you to access an easy-to-use, multiplatform, and scaled-out push infrastructure, which greatly simplifies the implementation of push notifications for both consumer and enterprise applications for mobile platforms.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to a specific app user on a specific device.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to a specific app user on a specific device.

trans-unit.source: An ASP.NET WebAPI backend is used to authenticate clients.
trans-unit.target: An ASP.NET WebAPI backend is used to authenticate clients.

trans-unit.source: Using the authenticated client user, and tag will be automatically added by the backend to notification registration.
trans-unit.target: Using the authenticated client user, and tag will be automatically added by the backend to notification registration.

trans-unit.source: This tag will be used to send by the backend to generate notifications for a specific user.
trans-unit.target: This tag will be used to send by the backend to generate notifications for a specific user.

trans-unit.source: For more information on registering for notifications using an app backend, see the guidance topic [Registering from your app backend](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn743807.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information on registering for notifications using an app backend, see the guidance topic [Registering from your app backend](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn743807.aspx).

trans-unit.source: This tutorial builds on the notification hub and project that you created in the [Get started with Notification Hubs] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial builds on the notification hub and project that you created in the [Get started with Notification Hubs] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is also the prerequisite to the [Secure Push] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is also the prerequisite to the [Secure Push] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: After you have completed the steps in this tutorial, you can proceed to the [Secure Push] tutorial, which shows how to modify the code in this tutorial to send a push notification securely.
trans-unit.target: After you have completed the steps in this tutorial, you can proceed to the [Secure Push] tutorial, which shows how to modify the code in this tutorial to send a push notification securely.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you start this tutorial, you must have already completed these Mobile Services tutorials:
trans-unit.target: Before you start this tutorial, you must have already completed these Mobile Services tutorials:

trans-unit.source: [Get started with Notification Hubs]
trans-unit.target: [Get started with Notification Hubs]

trans-unit.source: You create your notification hub and reserve the app name and register to receive notifications in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You create your notification hub and reserve the app name and register to receive notifications in this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial assumes you have already completed these steps.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial assumes you have already completed these steps.

trans-unit.source: If not, please follow the steps in [Getting Started with Notification Hubs (Windows Store)](notification-hubs-windows-store-dotnet-get-started.md); specifically, the sections [Register your app for the Windows Store](notification-hubs-windows-store-dotnet-get-started.md#register-your-app-for-the-windows-store) and [Configure your Notification Hub](notification-hubs-windows-store-dotnet-get-started.md#configure-your-notification-hub).
trans-unit.target: If not, please follow the steps in [Getting Started with Notification Hubs (Windows Store)](notification-hubs-windows-store-dotnet-get-started.md); specifically, the sections [Register your app for the Windows Store](notification-hubs-windows-store-dotnet-get-started.md#register-your-app-for-the-windows-store) and [Configure your Notification Hub](notification-hubs-windows-store-dotnet-get-started.md#configure-your-notification-hub).

trans-unit.source: In particular, make sure that you have entered the **Package SID** and **Client Secret** values in the portal, in the **Configure** tab for your notification hub.
trans-unit.target: In particular, make sure that you have entered the **Package SID** and **Client Secret** values in the portal, in the **Configure** tab for your notification hub.

trans-unit.source: This configuration procedure is described in the section [Configure your Notification Hub](notification-hubs-windows-store-dotnet-get-started.md#configure-your-notification-hub).
trans-unit.target: This configuration procedure is described in the section [Configure your Notification Hub](notification-hubs-windows-store-dotnet-get-started.md#configure-your-notification-hub).

trans-unit.source: This is an important step: if the credentials on the portal do not match those specified for the app name you choose, the push notification will not succeed.
trans-unit.target: This is an important step: if the credentials on the portal do not match those specified for the app name you choose, the push notification will not succeed.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you are using Mobile Services as your backend service, see the [Mobile Services version](../mobile-services-javascript-backend-windows-store-dotnet-push-notifications-app-users.md) of this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you are using Mobile Services as your backend service, see the [Mobile Services version](../mobile-services-javascript-backend-windows-store-dotnet-push-notifications-app-users.md) of this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Update the code for the client project
trans-unit.target: Update the code for the client project

trans-unit.source: In this section, you update the code in the project you completed for the [Get started with Notification Hubs] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you update the code in the project you completed for the [Get started with Notification Hubs] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: The should already be associated with the store and configured for your notification hub.
trans-unit.target: The should already be associated with the store and configured for your notification hub.

trans-unit.source: In this section, you will add code to call the new WebAPI backend and use it for registering and sending notifications.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you will add code to call the new WebAPI backend and use it for registering and sending notifications.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open the the solution you created for the [Get started with Notification Hubs] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open the the solution you created for the [Get started with Notification Hubs] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click the **(Windows 8.1)** project and then click **Manage NuGet Packages**.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click the **(Windows 8.1)** project and then click **Manage NuGet Packages**.

trans-unit.source: On the left-hand side, click **Online**.
trans-unit.target: On the left-hand side, click **Online**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Search** box, type **Http Client**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Search** box, type **Http Client**.

trans-unit.source: In the results list, click **Microsoft HTTP Client Libraries**, and then click **Install**.
trans-unit.target: In the results list, click **Microsoft HTTP Client Libraries**, and then click **Install**.

trans-unit.source: Complete the installation.
trans-unit.target: Complete the installation.

trans-unit.source: Back in the NuGet **Search** box, type **Json.net**.
trans-unit.target: Back in the NuGet **Search** box, type **Json.net**.

trans-unit.source: Install the **Json.NET** package, and then close the NuGet Package Manager window.
trans-unit.target: Install the **Json.NET** package, and then close the NuGet Package Manager window.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the steps above for the **(Windows Phone 8.1)** project to install the **JSON.NET** NuGet package for the Windows Phone project.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the steps above for the **(Windows Phone 8.1)** project to install the **JSON.NET** NuGet package for the Windows Phone project.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, in the **(Windows 8.1)** project, double-click **MainPage.xaml** to open it in the Visual Studio editor.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, in the **(Windows 8.1)** project, double-click **MainPage.xaml** to open it in the Visual Studio editor.

trans-unit.source: In the **MainPage.xaml** XML code, replace the `<Grid>` section with the following code.
trans-unit.target: In the **MainPage.xaml** XML code, replace the `<Grid>` section with the following code.

trans-unit.source: This code adds a username and password textbox that the user will authenticate with.
trans-unit.target: This code adds a username and password textbox that the user will authenticate with.

trans-unit.source: It also adds textboxes for the notification message and the username tag that should receive the notification:
trans-unit.target: It also adds textboxes for the notification message and the username tag that should receive the notification:

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, in the **(Windows Phone 8.1)** project, open **MainPage.xaml** and replace the Windows Phone 8.1 `<Grid>` section with that same code above.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, in the **(Windows Phone 8.1)** project, open **MainPage.xaml** and replace the Windows Phone 8.1 `<Grid>` section with that same code above.

trans-unit.source: The interface should look similar to whats shown below.
trans-unit.target: The interface should look similar to whats shown below.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, open the **MainPage.xaml.cs** file for the **(Windows 8.1)** and **(Windows Phone 8.1)** projects.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, open the **MainPage.xaml.cs** file for the **(Windows 8.1)** and **(Windows Phone 8.1)** projects.

trans-unit.source: Add the following `using` statements at the top of both files:
trans-unit.target: Add the following `using` statements at the top of both files:

trans-unit.source: In **MainPage.xaml.cs** for the **(Windows 8.1)** and **(Windows Phone 8.1)** projects, add the following member to the `MainPage` class.
trans-unit.target: In **MainPage.xaml.cs** for the **(Windows 8.1)** and **(Windows Phone 8.1)** projects, add the following member to the `MainPage` class.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to replace `<Enter Your Backend Endpoint>` with the your actual backend endpoint obtained previously.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to replace `<Enter Your Backend Endpoint>` with the your actual backend endpoint obtained previously.

trans-unit.source: For example, `http://mybackend.azurewebsites.net`.
trans-unit.target: For example, `http://mybackend.azurewebsites.net`.

trans-unit.source: Add the code below to the MainPage class in **MainPage.xaml.cs** for the **(Windows 8.1)** and **(Windows Phone 8.1)** projects.
trans-unit.target: Add the code below to the MainPage class in **MainPage.xaml.cs** for the **(Windows 8.1)** and **(Windows Phone 8.1)** projects.

trans-unit.source: The `PushClick` method is the click handler for the **Send Push** button.
trans-unit.target: The `PushClick` method is the click handler for the **Send Push** button.

trans-unit.source: It calls the backend to trigger a notification to all devices with a username tag that matches the `to_tag` parameter.
trans-unit.target: It calls the backend to trigger a notification to all devices with a username tag that matches the `to_tag` parameter.

trans-unit.source: The notification message is sent as JSON content in the request body.
trans-unit.target: The notification message is sent as JSON content in the request body.

trans-unit.source: The `LoginAndRegisterClick` method is the click handler for the **Log in and register** button.
trans-unit.target: The `LoginAndRegisterClick` method is the click handler for the **Log in and register** button.

trans-unit.source: It stores the basic authentication token in local storage (note that this represents any token your authentication scheme uses), then uses `RegisterClient` to register for notifications using the backend.
trans-unit.target: It stores the basic authentication token in local storage (note that this represents any token your authentication scheme uses), then uses `RegisterClient` to register for notifications using the backend.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, under the **Shared** project, open the **App.xaml.cs** file.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, under the **Shared** project, open the **App.xaml.cs** file.

trans-unit.source: Find the call to `InitNotificationsAsync()` in the `OnLaunched()` event handler.
trans-unit.target: Find the call to `InitNotificationsAsync()` in the `OnLaunched()` event handler.

trans-unit.source: Comment out or delete the call to `InitNotificationsAsync()`.
trans-unit.target: Comment out or delete the call to `InitNotificationsAsync()`.

trans-unit.source: The button handler added above will initialize notification registrations.
trans-unit.target: The button handler added above will initialize notification registrations.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click the **Shared** project, then click **Add**, and then click **Class**.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click the **Shared** project, then click **Add**, and then click **Class**.

trans-unit.source: Name the class **RegisterClient.cs**, then click **OK** to generate the class.
trans-unit.target: Name the class **RegisterClient.cs**, then click **OK** to generate the class.

trans-unit.source: This class will wrap the REST calls required to contact the app backend, in order to register for push notifications.
trans-unit.target: This class will wrap the REST calls required to contact the app backend, in order to register for push notifications.

trans-unit.source: It also locally stores the *registrationIds* created by the Notification Hub as detailed in [Registering from your app backend](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn743807.aspx).
trans-unit.target: It also locally stores the *registrationIds* created by the Notification Hub as detailed in [Registering from your app backend](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn743807.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Note that it uses an authorization token stored in local storage when you click the **Log in and register** button.
trans-unit.target: Note that it uses an authorization token stored in local storage when you click the **Log in and register** button.

trans-unit.source: Add the following `using` statements at the top of the RegisterClient.cs file:
trans-unit.target: Add the following `using` statements at the top of the RegisterClient.cs file:

trans-unit.source: Add the following code inside the `RegisterClient` class definition.
trans-unit.target: Add the following code inside the `RegisterClient` class definition.

trans-unit.source: Save all your changes.
trans-unit.target: Save all your changes.

trans-unit.source: Testing the Application
trans-unit.target: Testing the Application

trans-unit.source: Launch the application on both Windows 8.1 and Windows Phone 8.1.
trans-unit.target: Launch the application on both Windows 8.1 and Windows Phone 8.1.

trans-unit.source: For Windows Phone 8.1 you can run the instance in the emulator or an actual device.
trans-unit.target: For Windows Phone 8.1 you can run the instance in the emulator or an actual device.

trans-unit.source: In the Windows 8.1 instance of the app, enter a **Username** and **Password** as shown in the screen below.
trans-unit.target: In the Windows 8.1 instance of the app, enter a **Username** and **Password** as shown in the screen below.

trans-unit.source: It should differ from the user name and password you enter on Windows Phone.
trans-unit.target: It should differ from the user name and password you enter on Windows Phone.

trans-unit.source: Click **Log in and register** and verify a dialog shows that you have logged in.
trans-unit.target: Click **Log in and register** and verify a dialog shows that you have logged in.

trans-unit.source: This will also enable the **Send Push** button.
trans-unit.target: This will also enable the **Send Push** button.

trans-unit.source: On the Windows Phone 8.1 instance, enter a user name string in both the **Username** and **Password** fields then click **Login and register**.
trans-unit.target: On the Windows Phone 8.1 instance, enter a user name string in both the **Username** and **Password** fields then click **Login and register**.

trans-unit.source: Then in the **Recipient Username Tag** field, enter the user name registered on Windows 8.1.
trans-unit.target: Then in the **Recipient Username Tag** field, enter the user name registered on Windows 8.1.

trans-unit.source: Enter a notification message and click **Send Push**.
trans-unit.target: Enter a notification message and click **Send Push**.

trans-unit.source: Only the devices that have registered with the matching username tag receive the notification message.
trans-unit.target: Only the devices that have registered with the matching username tag receive the notification message.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: If you want to segment your users by interest groups, see [Use Notification Hubs to send breaking news].
trans-unit.target: If you want to segment your users by interest groups, see [Use Notification Hubs to send breaking news].

trans-unit.source: To learn more about how to use Notification Hubs, see [Notification Hubs Guidance].
trans-unit.target: To learn more about how to use Notification Hubs, see [Notification Hubs Guidance].
